input: Imagine a self-contained, hypothetical world with only the following conditions, and without any unmentioned factors or causal relationships: Age has a direct effect on hospital costs and recovery. Hospital costs has a direct effect on recovery. For patients who are young and pay a low hospital bill, the probability of recovery is 12%. For patients who are young and pay a high hospital bill, the probability of recovery is 23%. For patients who are old and pay a low hospital bill, the probability of recovery is 82%. For patients who are old and pay a high hospital bill, the probability of recovery is 89%. The overall probability of old age is 51%. Will high hospital bill increase the chance of recovery?
